name: AC Palacio de Santa Paula, Autograph Collection

reviews.text: We are Marriott Gold, and get automatic upgrades at check in. The first "deluxe" room shown confirmed everyone's complaints about the rooms. Small, dark, claustrophobic, no Windows - it was all of those things. The second room was basically the same. The first lines of a scathing review started to form in my head.
reviews.title: 5-star review (but it didn't start out this way)!

reviews.text: And then we were shown the room 223.
reviews.title: Great hotel, beautiful courtyard, lovely details

reviews.text: Oh, the room 223! Ah, the room 223.
reviews.title: Ok but NOT a 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a glorious room is the room 223!
reviews.title: for romance/couples/leisure: dark and depressing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the main room was similar to others, it had a small entry room (for luggage only) and an internal private balcony facing the room, almost like a courtyard inside your room. Completely private, it was a perfect place to end the evening with a drink and a cigar, while being seen by no one. The only windows opening to it were your own, so there wasn't even a chance someone might.see you.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here during our one-day visit to Granada. We wish we could have stayed longer, but we didn't have the time in our busy itinerary. The superior room we stayed in was in the old convent. Although it had no external window, the room was charming and spacious. The staff were extremely helpful. The hotel was a short ride from the train station, a short walk to the center of town (near restaurants and various sights), and a taxi ride of about 10 minutes to the Alhambra.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location on the Grand Via de Colon just up the street from the Cathedral. Everything was within walking distance although we did take the #30 bus up to the Alhambra and the #31 bus up to the St. Nicholas view point.
reviews.title: Great Location
Historic convent mixed with a Moorish feel
reviews.text: The hotel is small with only about 75 rooms – the building was originally an old convent and still had a brick-arched inner courtyard. Our 'standard' room was modern with a large bathroom and great tub. Didn’t seem like they had the air conditioning turned on…but since it was really cool weather we could open the window to get some air in the room – but it was REALLY noisy from the traffic below on Via Colon. We did have a great view and could see the Alhambra and snow capped mountains from our room.

The internet was free in the lobby/cloister area but not in the rooms. In this day and age Internet access should be a standard amenity. Our rate of €138.60 including tax did not include their buffet breakfast which was really expensive at €20 per person. There were several places nearby to get either a pastry or more complete breakfast.
reviews.title: Spanish feel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the convent side in a superior room with a nice view of the courtyard. We arrived from the Alhambra with the help of our GPS, which several times got seriously confused. But we did get to see Granada as the locals were dressed in flamenco dresses heading towards a celebration. The room was a nice size, bed comfy, bathroom roomy, robe and slippers nice touch. The location was great ,near everything. If you take a local bus it is an inexpensive way to see Granada, we took one up to St. Nicholas church for a fabulous view of the Alhambra and Granada then walked back into town. Parking expensive, but it was more convenient than trying to find parking. Breakfast expensive so we ate local. Watch out for the gypsies near the cathedral. Use the free wifi in the lobby. We had to ask the receptionist when checking in for a map and to show us where exactly we were, other than that everyone friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: A very pleasant, conveniently situated hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was nice, good room, double pained windows, no noise even though our room faced the street, it was very quiet. The rooms were clean, good bathroom, good bed and pillows.
reviews.title: This hotel could have made it to very good, but they missed.

reviews.text: The staff at the front dest was friendly and helpful. The three reasons I will not give this hotel a great rating, breakfast was 22 E per person, had to pay for wifi and the parking rate is 21.18 when it states online that it is 18E. When I asked the girl at the front desk about the parking rate and showed her that my paper said 18 and she charged me 21.18 she made not effort to credit me the difference. This I find not to be great service. We did not stay in the charming part, but in the newer section, and the rooms were still good.
reviews.title: Probably best choice in Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is centrally located and great for walking everywhere.
reviews.title: Beautiful old convent setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was thinking about staying at the parador, but with 2 rooms for family of four, it would cost an arm and a leg. I was very happy that I chose AC Palacio. I started emailing with them before I arrived there and Javier, one of the receptionist, arranged a car transportation for me from Granada to Cordoba. Upon arrival, he confirmed the transportation, made couple of reservations for dinner, and was very, very helpful. The rooms that we were given were excellent. They were all in the convent section, immaculately renovated. My husband loved the terrace that came with it. The two things that dampened my satisfaction was: the first morning, there was a bit group at the breakfast and the service was much to be desired. Coffee pot was never refilled. By second morning, the group was gone, and we had a civilized breakfast. Second night (June 8th), there was party at the terrace until after midnight. You know how Spanish people talk! I didn't complain but a lot of early sleepers were complaining about it. All and all, I would recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful conversion of a former convent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were two couples and a single in our 70's, staying two nights in this hotel in mid May, 2013. Having read reviews before our trip, we requested rooms in the older section of the hotel and were not disappointed. The rooms were on the top floor and the exposed beam ceilings were beautiful. The exterior wall was lined with high windows which allowed a view of the old interior courtyard. The bathrooms were updated, modern, clean and spacious. We hunted all over the room for the safe but after a call to the front desk, learned the room did not have one. No alarm clocks either. Safes, however, are available adjacent to the lobby reception desk. Also, there is no wi-fi in the rooms but wi-fi is available in the lobby. At night, the rooms are poorly lit. We found it disappointing for a five star hotel not to have in-room wi-fi or safes. Also, the advertized "free" mini bar is free only if you take the single bottle of water......the rest is charged as usual.
reviews.title: Feel at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at AC Palacio de Santa Paula for one night only. First impressions were good.The staff were great at organsing a tour of the Alhambra for us which we had forgotten to do.
reviews.title: 4 star but lacking soul

reviews.text: We stayed in a junior suite which was lovely but very dark (room 131). The room was very clean and comfortable, bed was okay.
reviews.title: A Palace of hotel in an ideal location

reviews.text: We had a meal in the restuerant which was okay but a little overdone and all the food was really salty. I am not sure why.
reviews.title: A pleasant & relaxing stay

reviews.text: Breakfast is good but not included as neither was wi-fi. it is a gripe of mine that you pay €250 for a hotel room and have to pay for wi-fi on top of that. it seems ridiculous.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, opt for convent rooms...
